intro: Hieracium arizaletae, commonly known as the Arizalet hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense, daisy-like cluster. Hieracium arizaletae is noted for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions, making it a characteristic species of high-altitude ecosystems.
